timeline.bodyText: What is the rationale of having scope being used with endsWith  and beanClass used startsWith?
timeline.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I believe that it's practical. For scopes, users will usually pass built-in scope names. So it's more convenient to specify RequestScoped rather than javax.enterprise.context.RequestScoped. Also simple names of scopes do not usually collide. For bean classes however, it's very often useful to filter beans from a specific package, i.e. beanClass=org.acme.
